message.content:
There are several ways to save a Wordle:

1. Screenshot: One of the easiest methods is to take a screenshot of your completed puzzle and save it as an image file on your device. On most computers, you can press "PrtScn" or "Cmd+Shift+4" (Mac) to capture the screen.

2. Save as PDF: If using Wordle from a browser, click on "Print" in Wordle's toolbar or press "Ctrl + P." Then, instead of selecting a printer, choose "Save as PDF" from the dropdown menu.

3. Export as SVG: Right-click on the completed puzzle and select "Inspect element." Look for an '<svg>' tag containing all elements related to the puzzle board; right-click that tag and choose 'Copy outerHTML.' Next:
    - Open text editor
    - Paste content copied previously
    - Save file with ".svg" extension

Please note you may need an SVG viewer/editor like Adobe Illustrator or Inkscape(open-source alternative) to view/edit this format.

These are some common ways people save their puzzles on various devices. The best method depends on what tools/apps are available for each user/device/browser combo they're working with at that time.
